All sources used here are fictional.</span><br />&nbsp;</p>","rightText":"<p><img alt=\"\" src=\"data:image/png;base64,\" /></p>","settings":{"showHeader":1,"showAudio":1,"audioPath":"","hideRightPanel":0,"showNext":1,"delayStep":"0","delayRight":"0","showRFB":0}},{"settings":{"showAudio":1,"showNext":1,"showHeader":1,"hideRightPanel":1,"delayStep":0,"delayRight":0,"showRFB":0},"leftText":"<p>Your writing consists mostly of your own words and ideas, but you need to support your ideas with the words and ideas of others.<br /><br />You can present information from other sources using <strong>direct quotations</strong>, <strong>paraphrasing</strong>, or <strong>summarizing</strong>.<br /><br />You decide which of those techniques to use based upon what you are trying to tell your readers.<br />&nbsp;</p><table cellpadding=\"1\" cellspacing=\"1\" class=\"ju-table\" style=\"width:100%;\"><tbody><tr><td><strong>Use. . .</strong></td><td><strong>When you. . .</strong></td></tr><tr><td>Direct quotations</td><td>want your reader to view the exact words from your source.</td></tr><tr><td>Paraphrasing</td><td>want to present the main points and all the details using your own words.</td></tr><tr><td>Summarizing</td><td>have lots of information and want to include only the main points.&nbsp;</td></tr></tbody></table><p>&nbsp;</p>","rightText":null,"headerText":"Integrating sources into your writing"},{"settings":{"showAudio":1,"showNext":1,"showHeader":0,"hideRightPanel":1,"delayStep":0,"delayRight":0,"showRuler":0,"showRFB":0},"leftText":"<p>Fill in the blanks in the following statements.<br /><br />1.&nbsp; Your writing should synthesize the material you have learned.<br /><br />Simply including multiple quotations, summaries, or paraphrases from other sources does not show your reader enough original thinking.<br />&nbsp;</p>","rightText":null,"headerText":"Balancing the words and ideas of others with your own ideas"},{"settings":{"showAudio":1,"showNext":0,"showHeader":0,"hideRightPanel":1,"delayStep":0,"delayRight":0,"fullWhiteboard":0,"showRFB":0},"leftText":"<p>What is the key problem with this paragraph?</p><table border=\"1\" cellpadding=\"1\" cellspacing=\"1\" class=\"ju-tableplain\" style=\"width: 90%;\"><tbody><tr><td><p><span class=\"ju-examples\" style=\"color:#552656;font-family:tahoma;font-size:15px;\">Acadia National Park is the northernmost and easternmost national park in the United States (Jefferson, 2012).&nbsp; It is also the &quot;oldest national park east of the Mississippi River&quot; (Jefferson, 2012, p. 17).&nbsp; Over the course of its history, its name has changed three times: from Sieur du Monts National Park in 1916, to Lafayette National Park in 1919, to Acadia National Park in 1929 (Jefferson, 2012). The park is located in the northern part of Maine near Bar Harbor (Maine Travel Board, 2017).</span></p></td></tr></tbody></table>","rightText":null},{"settings":{"showAudio":1,"showNext":1,"showHeader":0,"hideRightPanel":1,"delayStep":0,"delayRight":0,"showRuler":0,"showRFB":0},"leftText":"<p><jumc ju-mc=\"mc_806a9486-8112-0722-bdd8-0f3aaeffacb1\" style=\"width: 200px; return false;\">Balancing your ideas and your sources: Picture it!</a><br />&nbsp;</p>","rightText":null},{"settings":{"showAudio":1,"showNext":1,"showHeader":1,"hideRightPanel":1,"delayStep":0,"delayRight":0,"showRFB":0},"leftText":"<p>Your reader needs to know when your ideas begin and end and what words and ideas are borrowed from others.<br /><br />One way you can do this is by using a <strong>signal phrase </strong>such as <em>According to Martinez</em> or <em>As Paula Martinez explains</em> and include the source&#39;s date in parentheses.&nbsp;<br /><br />If your signal phrase introduces a direct quotation, include the page or paragraph number at the end of the direct quotation:</p><p><img alt=\"\" src=\"data:image/png;base64,\" /><br /><br /><br />Using a signal phrase is considered citing.&nbsp; It lets the reader know the author of your source.<br />&nbsp;</p><p>&nbsp;</p><p>&nbsp;</p><p>&nbsp;</p>","rightText":"<p><br /><br />&nbsp;</p>","headerText":"Using signal phrases"},{"settings":{"showAudio":1,"showNext":0,"showHeader":0,"hideRightPanel":1,"delayStep":0,"delayRight":0,"showRFB":0},"leftText":"<p>Which signal phrase does the writer use in this paragraph from your article about hiking to indicate that ideas are borrowed from another source?</p><table border=\"1\" cellpadding=\"1\" cellspacing=\"1\" class=\"ju-tableplain\" style=\"width: 100%;\"><tbody><tr><td><p><span class=\"ju-examples\" style=\"color:#552656;font-family:tahoma;font-size:15px;\">Dedicated hikers can easily spend a week hiking the many beautiful trails in Yosemite National Park.&nbsp; However, hikers should be aware that some hikes are much more strenuous than others and know their own capabilities and limitations.&nbsp; Hiking expert Paula Martinez (2016) suggests, &quot;Before you begin planning any strenuous hikes, you should visit your doctor to ensure that you are physically fit and able to handle the rigors of the trail.&nbsp; You need to know not only the distance you will be hiking, but also the elevation gain&quot; (p. 52).&nbsp; This makes it easy to find a trail that is safe and fun for you.&nbsp; For example, beginners should start with the Bridalveil Fall Trail and Lower Yosemite Fall Trail, both of which are considered easy (Martinez, 2016).</span></p></td></tr></tbody></table>","rightText":null},{"settings":{"showAudio":1,"showNext":1,"showHeader":0,"hideRightPanel":1,"delayStep":0,"delayRight":0,"showRuler":0,"showRFB":0},"leftText":"<p><jumc ju-mc=\"mc_ab9cafe0-edc9-1d46-315c-828295ee2e87\" style=\"width: 200px; It is also the &quot;oldest national park east of the Mississippi River&quot; <span class=\"marker\">(Jefferson, 2012, p. 17).</span>&nbsp;</span></p></td></tr></tbody></table><p>&nbsp;</p>","rightText":null},{"settings":{"showAudio":1,"showNext":1,"showHeader":0,"hideRightPanel":1,"delayStep":0,"delayRight":0,"showRFB":0},"leftText":"<p>Is it better to cite your source using the&nbsp;author&#39;s name in a signal phrase or with an in-text citation?&nbsp;<br /><br />The choice is yours.<br /><br />Good writers vary their style to keep readers&#39; interest.&nbsp; Try reading your work aloud and experimenting with both ways of acknowledging the author or source.<br />&nbsp;</p>","rightText":null},{"settings":{"showAudio":1,"showNext":1,"showHeader":1,"hideRightPanel":1,"delayStep":0,"delayRight":0,"showRFB":0},"leftText":"<p>If you use many pieces of information from the same source within one paragraph, acknowledge the source <strong>each time</strong> you include a direct quotation, paraphrase, or summary in the paragraph.<br />&nbsp;</p>","rightText":null,"headerText":"Citing the same source more than once in a paragraph"},{"settings":{"showAudio":1,"showNext":1,"showHeader":0,"hideRightPanel":1,"delayStep":0,"delayRight":0,"showRuler":0,"showRFB":0},"leftText":"<p>This paragraph from your article about hiking in the national parks includes information that all comes from a blog post that was published on March 10, 2017.<br /><br />It includes two paraphrases and direct quotation, all from Lydia Tan&#39;s blog post.&nbsp; Indicate whether each sentence requires a citation.</p><table border=\"1\" cellpadding=\"1\" cellspacing=\"1\" class=\"ju-tableplain\" style=\"width: 100%;\"><tbody><tr><td><p><span class=\"ju-double-space\" style=\"color:#552656;font-family:lato,sans-serif;font-size:15px;line-height:180%;\">Visiting a national park can be costly and it is easy to overlook some of your expenses.&nbsp;&nbsp; During peak season, park entrance fees can be as much as $30 per vehicle or even more</span><span class=\"ju-examples\" style=\"color:#552656;font-family:tahoma;font-size:15px;\"> </span><jumc ju-mc=\"mc_cb82eb19-8e0f-62fd-54fb-7c5848545845\" style=\"width: 200px; background: rgb(163, 228, 255) none repeat scroll 0% 0%; -moz-user-select: none;\"><strong>ID: mc_cb82...</strong></jumc><span class=\"ju-examples\" style=\"color:#552656;font-family:tahoma;font-size:15px;\">. </span><span class=\"ju-double-space\" style=\"color:#552656;font-family:lato,sans-serif;font-size:15px;line-height:180%;\">Getting to and from the park usually involves a long trip of some sort, with the cost of airplane fares and rental cars, or the cost of gasoline and wear and tear on your own car</span><span class=\"ju-examples\" style=\"color:#552656;font-family:tahoma;font-size:15px;\"> </span><jumc ju-mc=\"mc_2fecac01-0d2a-4896-dda8-3d8205e5d95a\" style=\"width: 200px; background: rgb(163, 228, 255) none repeat scroll 0% 0%; -moz-user-select: none;\"><strong>ID: mc_2fec...</strong></jumc><span class=\"ju-examples\" style=\"color:#552656;font-family:tahoma;font-size:15px;\">. </span><span class=\"ju-double-space\" style=\"color:#552656;font-family:lato,sans-serif;font-size:15px;line-height:180%;\">Many hotels in national parks &ldquo;know that travelers to the national parks have few hotel choices, so they charge a premium fee&rdquo;</span><span class=\"ju-examples\" style=\"color:#552656;font-family:tahoma;font-size:15px;\"> </span><jumc ju-mc=\"mc_b4b96fbf-722a-400f-ddfc-3eff63213f82\" style=\"width: 200px; background: rgb(163, 228, 255) none repeat scroll 0% 0%; -moz-user-select: none;\"><strong>ID: mc_b4b9...</strong></jumc><span class=\"ju-examples\" style=\"color:#552656;font-family:tahoma;font-size:15px;\">.&nbsp; </span><span class=\"ju-double-space\" style=\"color:#552656;font-family:lato,sans-serif;font-size:15px;line-height:180%;\">From my own experience, I know that other costs that add up quickly include food and the equipment necessary to keep you safe and sheltered from the weather</span><span class=\"ju-examples\" style=\"color:#552656;font-family:tahoma;font-size:15px;\"> </span><jumc ju-mc=\"mc_f33eb6b3-9364-5c88-6bc2-72ed1f310a8e\" style=\"width: 200px; background: rgb(163, 228, 255) none repeat scroll 0% 0%; -moz-user-select: none;\"><strong>ID: mc_f33e...</strong></jumc><span class=\"ju-examples\" style=\"color:#552656;font-family:tahoma;font-size:15px;\">.</span></p></td></tr></tbody></table><p>&nbsp;</p>","rightText":null},{"settings":{"showAudio":1,"showNext":0,"showHeader":0,"hideRightPanel":1,"delayStep":0,"delayRight":0,"showRuler":0,"showRFB":0},"leftText":"<p>You can use a signal phrase to acknowledge the source each time you use it.<br /><br />If you use a signal phrase more than once, then you only need to include the date in parentheses the first time you mention the source.</p>","rightText":null},{"settings":{"showAudio":1,"showNext":1,"showHeader":0,"hideRightPanel":1,"delayStep":0,"delayRight":0,"showRFB":0},"leftText":"<p>In this paragraph, you use two ideas by Stephen Jefferson.&nbsp; Choose the best signal phrase to introduce each idea.</p><table border=\"1\" cellpadding=\"1\" cellspacing=\"1\" class=\"ju-tableplain\" style=\"width: 100%;\"><tbody><tr><td><p class=\"ju-double-space\" span=\"\" style=\"color:#552656;font-family:lato,sans-serif;font-size:15px;line-height:180%;\">Several of our most glorious national parks are located at &quot;land&#39;s end&quot;&mdash;close to an ocean&mdash;and several are located on the country&#39;s northern border with Canada. One of my favorite parks is Maine&#39;s Acadia National Park, the easternmost national park. Some of the park&#39;s most beautiful features are Echo Lake Beach, Jordan Pond, Otter Cove, and Thunder Hole. However, if you are going to visit only one part of Acadia, I recommend Cadillac Mountain. However, you&#39;ll need to get there before sunrise. What makes Cadillac Mountain so special? There, according to Stephen Jefferson <jumc ju-mc=\"mc_b61698c3-65e0-6387-15fa-cb53f35b8eb7\" style=\"width: 200px; background: rgb(163, 228, 255) none repeat scroll 0% 0%; -moz-user-select: none;\">&nbsp;&nbsp;<strong>ID: mc_b616...</strong></jumc>, &quot;you can see the sun rise earlier than you can at any other place within the United States&quot; (p. 17).&nbsp; Jefferson <jumc ju-mc=\"mc_a20ffeb8-52a6-2bad-7b21-672e5ac7d202\" style=\"width: 200px; background: rgb(163, 228, 255) none repeat scroll 0% 0%; -moz-user-select: none;\"><strong>ID: mc_a20f...</strong></jumc><span> </span>also points out that you shouldn&#39;t expect to watch the sunrise all alone on Cadillac Mountain, because dozens of other hikers will probably have arrived there before you do.</p></td></tr></tbody></table><p>&nbsp;</p>","rightText":null,"headerText":""},{"settings":{"showAudio":1,"showNext":1,"showHeader":0,"hideRightPanel":1,"delayStep":0,"delayRight":0,"showRFB":0},"leftText":"<p>This paragraph includes one direct quotation and two paraphrases, all from Paula Martinez&#39;s book.&nbsp; Each one is cited:</p><ul style=\"padding-left:15px;\"><li>The direct quotation is introduced by a signal phrase: <span class=\"ju-examples\" style=\"color:#552656;font-family:tahoma;font-size:15px;\">Hiking expert Paula Martinez (2016), author of <em>The Hiker&#39;s Guide to Yosemite</em>, suggests....</span>&nbsp; This signal phrase tells readers the source of the direct quotation.<br />&nbsp;</li><li>The paraphrase that begins <span class=\"ju-examples\" style=\"color:#552656;font-family:tahoma;font-size:15px;\">Beginners should start . . .</span> is not introduced by a signal phrase, and it has a citation at the end that includes the author&#39;s last name and the date.<br />&nbsp;</li><li>The same is true of the paraphrase that begins <span class=\"ju-examples\" style=\"color:#552656;font-family:tahoma;font-size:15px;\">In contrast, Snow Creek Trail ...</span>. It is not introduced by a signal phrase, so it has a citation at the end that includes the author&#39;s last name and the date.<br />&nbsp;</li></ul><table border=\"1\" cellpadding=\"1\" cellspacing=\"1\" class=\"ju-tableplain\" style=\"width: 90%;\"><tbody><tr><td><p><span class=\"ju-examples\" style=\"color:#552656;font-family:tahoma;font-size:15px;\">Dedicated hikers can easily spend a week hiking the many beautiful trails in Yosemite National Park.&nbsp; However, hikers should be aware that some hikes are much more strenuous than others and know their own capabilities and limitations.&nbsp; Hiking expert <span class=\"marker\">Paula Martinez (2016), author of <em>The Hiker&#39;s Guide to Yosemite,</em> suggests,</span> &quot;Before you begin planning any strenuous hikes, you should visit your doctor to ensure that you are physically fit and able to handle the rigors of the trail.&nbsp; You need to know not only the distance you will be hiking, but also the elevation gain&quot; <span class=\"marker\">(p. 52)</span>.&nbsp; This makes it easy to find a trail that is safe and fun for you.&nbsp; Beginners should start with the Bridalveil Fall Trail and Lower Yosemite Fall Trail, both of which are considered easy <span class=\"marker\">(Martinez, 2016)</span>.&nbsp; In contrast, Snow Creek Trail and Half Dome Trail are both strenuous; you shouldn&#39;t attempt them unless you have ample hiking experience <span class=\"marker\">(Martinez, 2016)</span>.</span></p></td></tr></tbody></table><p>&nbsp;</p>","rightText":null},{"settings":{"showAudio":1,"showNext":1,"showHeader":1,"hideRightPanel":1,"delayStep":0,"delayRight":0,"showRFB":0},"leftText":"<p>If you are including information from different authors or sources, then the citation rules apply to each author or source.<br />&nbsp;</p>","rightText":null,"headerText":"Citing different sources within the same paragraph"},{"settings":{"showAudio":1,"showNext":1,"showHeader":0,"hideRightPanel":1,"delayStep":0,"delayRight":0,"showRuler":0,"showRFB":0},"leftText":"<p>This paragraph from your article about hiking includes information from three different sources.<br />&nbsp;</p><ul style=\"padding-left:15px;\"><li>Terrence Trent wrote an article titled &quot;The Glories of Glacier National Park&quot; for <em>World Traveler</em> magazine.&nbsp; It was published on May 18, 2015.&nbsp; In the article, Trent notes that Chief Mountain is very popular with visitors.<br />&nbsp;</li><li>Stephen Jefferson wrote an article titled &quot;All About Acadia: The Basics&quot; for The<em> Journal of Parks and Recreation</em>. The article was published on July 15, 2012.&nbsp; This is a direct quotation from p. 20:&nbsp; &quot;Some of the park&#39;s most popular features are Cadillac Mountain the Blue Hill Overlook.&quot;<br />&nbsp;</li><li>&nbsp;Lydia Tan wrote a blog post published on March 10, 2017 reviewing some of the famous rock-climbing destinations in the national parks.</li></ul><p><br />Add the correct citations to the paragraph:</p><table border=\"1\" cellpadding=\"1\" cellspacing=\"1\" class=\"ju-tableplain\" style=\"width: 100%;\"><tbody><tr><td><p style=\"line-height:180%;\"><span class=\"ju-examples\" style=\"color:#552656;font-family:tahoma;font-size:15px;\">Geologic formations are an extremely important part of the national park experience.&nbsp; All of the parks are home to mountains and outcroppings that offer beautiful photo opps. quotation.</li></ul></td></tr></tbody></table><p>&nbsp;</p><table border=\"0\" cellpadding=\"1\" cellspacing=\"1\" class=\"ju-summary\" style=\"width:90%;\"><thead><tr><th scope=\"col\">More than one citation in a paragraph</th></tr></thead><tbody><tr><td><ul><li>When you paraphrase, summarize, or quote a source more than once within a paragraph, acknowledge the source each time you use it with either a signal phrase or a citation in parentheses.</li><li>When you use multiple signal phrases to acknowledge the same source within a paragraph, only include a citation in parentheses with the first signal phrase.&nbsp;This pattern starts over with each new paragraph.</li><li>When you use multiple sources within a paragraph, the same rules apply.&nbsp; Each time you use a piece of information from a source, you must acknowledge it.</li></ul><img alt=\"\" src=\"/images/picture_it.png\" style=\"width: 27px; height: 27px;\" />&nbsp; <a However, hikers should be aware that some hikes are much more strenuous than others and know their own capabilities and limitations.&nbsp; Hiking expert Paula Martinez (2016), author of <em>The Hiker&rsquo;s Guide to Yosemite</em>, suggests, &quot;Before you begin planning any strenuous hikes, you should visit your doctor to ensure that you are physically fit and able to handle the rigors of the trail.&nbsp;
